definition[0]: an administrative process that takes more time and uses more documents than seem reasonable
example[0]: It is possible to claim back the tax, but this involves something of a paperchase.
definition[1]: an occasion when a company sells a lot of new shares to finance a series of takeovers
definition[2]: a very careful search through a large amount of documents or books
example[1]: It took a long paperchase through the archives to find the report.
